p: Over the years, the use of prophylactic drugs and antibiotic growth promoters in animal feeding has become commonplace. However, the continuous use of these compounds resulted in outcomes such as the emergence of resistant bacteria and antibiotic residues in meat and other livestock products which pose a risk to public health and the environment ( Jazi etÂ al., 2018a). This concern has led many countries to restrict the use of antibiotics in animal feed. Accordingly, it is necessary to identify cost-effective, safe, and eco-friendly alternatives to antibiotics.
